DOC.brief_title: Effects Thoracic Mobilization Shoulder Range Motion
DOC.detailed_description: Many individual primary complaint shoulder pain often demonstrate deficit glenohumeral scapulothoracic mobility . Typically individual limitation shoulder range motion , specifically , flexion ( elevation ) well external internal rotation . Although glenohumeral joint primary joint shoulder motion adjacent joint sternoclavicular , acromioclavicular , scapulothoracic , thoracic spine also contribute maximal shoulder motion . Limited shoulder motion may result joint hypomobility , muscle inhibition , pain . Typically intervention stretch joint mobilization/manipulation direct glenohumeral joint improve shoulder motion , little known intervention target adjacent site may also improve shoulder range motion . This study evaluate effect thoracic spine joint manipulation active passive shoulder range motion .
DOC.criteria: Adults 1945 year Individuals pregnant History cervical thoracic surgery Bone joint disease Current infection tumor Osteopenia/osteoporosis Spinal fracture Rheumatologic pathology
